presentationTitle: Creating a Visually Balanced Slide Deck

slides.title: Creating a Visually Balanced Slide Deck
slides.subtitle: From Provided Text

slides.title: Goal
slides.paragraph: Create a complete, visually balanced slide deck from the provided text. Choose slide layouts and per-slide typography/formatting. Include a Title slide yourself. Add a Table of Contents if the deck benefits from it. Add a Conclusion slide if it helps. Add an Appendix ONLY if you detect external links; produce MLA9-styled citations.

slides.title: Schema
slides.paragraph: The provided schema defines the structure and requirements for the slide deck, including the presentation title, slide count, theme, and details for each slide.

slides.title: Style Rules
slides.paragraph: The style rules guide the visual design of the slide deck, including font choices, sizing, alignment, and use of color. These rules help ensure a visually balanced and consistent presentation.

slides.title: Slide 1: Title Slide
slides.paragraph: The title slide includes the presentation title and subtitle, using a centered layout and larger font sizes to establish the overall tone and branding.

slides.title: Slide 2: Goal
slides.paragraph: This slide clearly outlines the goal of the presentation, using a concise and informative paragraph format.

slides.title: Conclusion
slides.paragraph: By following the provided schema and style rules, you can create a visually balanced and engaging slide deck that effectively communicates the key information to your audience.
